Questions: Can I call when I travel abroad with my prepaid SIMcard?

Please note that the availability of Prepaid Roaming depends on the foreign network operator their coverage and the handset used.

Questions: What is the range of Trackimo ?
FAQ Question: How far will my Trackimo track or locate?
Answers: Your device can be located as long as there is GSM cellular service area and if you have purchased a roaming plan when the device is outside of Singapore. If the device enters an area without GSM cellular coverage the GPS feature will not be able to report its current location until it re-enters an area with network coverage. Once it reconnects it will transmit a history of its locations that you can view on the AssuredPlus app.

Questions: I bough a MobileShare line for my child. How are we charged?
FAQ Question: I have given my child a MobileShare line. How will I be charged for his usage?
Answers: For Mobile customers whose bundle includes talktime SMS/MMS and data the usage by the MobileShare customer will be Â offset from the main line bundle. Prevailing excess usage applies Â once you have exceeded your voice/data bundle. For example: Lite Plan with 100 mins talktime 800 SMS and 2GB Data MobileShare Plan with 0.5GB Data Total Share: 100 mins talkitme 800 SMS and 2.5GB Data Excess usage will be charged at pay per use. Mobile Broadband plan: Usage will be charged as per pay-per-use on the talktime/sms and mms. Data usage on the supplementary line will offset from the main line data bundle. Prevailing excess charges and monthly bill cap apply after customer has exceeded the free local data bundle.

Questions: I have lost my phone. What to do?

Questions: My problem wasn't solved by the on-site assessment and I've been charged, why?
FAQ Question: I was told by the engineer that the cause of the issue might be due to 3rd party devices and despite the on-site assessment the issue still cannot be resolved. Why am I still charged for the on-site assessment?
Answers: Our engineers specialise only in devices/ equipment sold by Singtel and will ensure proper diagnosis before recommending solutions to address your issue. However if it is identified that the cause of network connection issues might be due to 3rd party devices connected to your Broadband service we recommend that you refer to the device manufacturer for assistance as our engineers are not trained in these devices. Please note that the on-site assessment will still be applicable at $60 (weekdays/weekends).

Questions: What are the advantages of Singtel Fibre Broadband?
FAQ Question: What are the benefits I can enjoy with Singtel Fibre Broadband?
Answers: A. Consistently fast speeds IDA findings show that Singtel is fastest in average international download speeds among broadband users on 200Mbps plans as of May 2015. With no international bandwidth cap you can surf web content at speeds of up to 1Gbps. B. Multiple access multiple users Even with multiple users and devices in the family everyone can enjoy smooth Internet connection with Singtel Fibre Broadband. Be it on laptops tablets or mobile phones the simultaneous multiple access supports even bandwidth-intensive applications such as data downloading or music and video streaming. C. End-to-end service With an end-to-end solution that comprises bundled high-end routers installation and maintenance services in addition to Internet access Singtel cares by ensuring your Broadband experience is hassle-free right from the start.

Questions: How much is the installation?
FAQ Question: What are the installation charges like?
Answers: If you missed your free prior appointment with NetLink Trust an installation charge of $235.40Â (with 7% GST) for High Rise or $481.50(with 7% GST) for landed property is applicable. The above amount is charged on behalf of NetLink Trust. If you have already made an appointment with NetLink Trust to lay the fibre and install the 1st TP (Fibre Termination Point) to your home a Singtel installation appointment would only be required to set up your Singtel Fibre Broadband services. An installation charge of $90* (weekdays) or $145* (weekends) by Singtel is applicable for installation of equipment activation and demo of service. This installation charge will also be levied if the customer is not available for installation appointment or does not meet the minimum system requirements. Wiring charge of $80.25Â will apply for wiring service from the modem to each computer/device within the first 35m additional $10 is applicable for every subsequent 5m wiring length. The wiring service is free for 1st Singtel TV set-top box on Singtel Fibre Entertainment Bundle however it is chargeable for each subsequent new Singtel TV set-top box sign-ups. A registration charge of $53.50* is applicable for all Singtel Fibre Home Bundle plans. * inclusive of 7% GST.

Questions: The device I received doesn't work. What can I do?

Questions: What is Singtel?
FAQ Question: What is Singtel Fibre Broadband?
Answers: Singtel Fibre Broadband is Singtel's high speed fibre service and it is delivered via an opticalfibre which is run directly into one's home. Through Singtel Fibre Broadband services consumers can enjoy amazing download speeds of up to 1Gbps which is superior to that of any other existing DSL or cable broadband network available. This allows for ultra high speed Internet access digital voice Internet television services home networking and other lifestyle applications. Customers can enjoy bandwidth intensive applications such as simultaneous music downloads home office and home networking with greater ease and also run multiple applications on one PC such as online chat web access and music or video downloads.

Questions: How do we install the equipment?
FAQ Question: What is the process of installation?
Answers: Upon the home ownerâ€™s notification Singtel will initiate a site survey and advice on what shall be carried out. If relocation of existing infrastructure (pipe & cable) is needed Singtel will send the quotation letter to the home owner. Upon receipt of Cheque Singtel will engage relevant authorities like Power Grids NParks and Land Transport Authority for approvals prior to excavation in order to connect the new lead-in pipe provided by the home owner from the gate pillar to the manhole.

Questions: My battery life finish very fast why?
FAQ Question: How long does the battery last?
Answers: Under normal use the battery can last up to 48 hours. Please note that several factors can affect the battery life including temperature network signal strength and locator features used. For example if the device is in a very limited cell (GSM) coverage area this will require the device to work harder to obtain a signal resulting in less battery life. Also the more frequently you track the device the faster the battery will be used.

Questions: Fixed line number retention
FAQ Question: What is Fixed Line Number Retention Service?
Answers: Fixed Line Number Retention is a number portability service that allows you to retain your existing telephone phone number when you switch from other service provider to Singtel. Enjoy crystal clear calls with our Singtel Telephone Line or unlimited local calls with Home Digital Line without giving up your existing telephone phone number. Visit our Singtel Shops if you wish to apply for this service. Upon application we would arrange on your behalf with the other service provider to terminate your existing fixed-line service and transfer it to Singtel. The process would typically take more than 7 working days as time is required by the other operator to process the request. Once the service is activated your telephone number (from the other service provider) will be port over.

Questions: Any charges for installation?

Answers: If you missed your free prior appointment with NetLink Trust an installation charge of $235.40Â (with 7% GST) for High Rise or $481.50(with 7% GST) for landed property is applicable. The above amount is charged on behalf of NetLink Trust. If you have already made an appointment with NetLink Trust to lay the fibre and install the 1st TP (Fibre Termination Point) to your home a Singtel installation appointment would only be required to set up your Singtel Fibre Broadband services. An installation charge of $90* (weekdays) or $145* (weekends) by Singtel is applicable for installation of equipment activation and demo of service. This installation charge will also be levied if the customer is not available for installation appointment or does not meet the minimum system requirements. Wiring charge of $80.25Â will apply for wiring service from the modem to each computer/device within the first 35m additional $10 is applicable for every subsequent 5m wiring length. The wiring service is free for 1st Singtel TV set-top box on Singtel Fibre Entertainment Bundle however it is chargeable for each subsequent new Singtel TV set-top box sign-ups. A registration charge of $53.50* is applicable for all Singtel Fibre Home Bundle plans. * inclusive of 7% GST.

Questions: Termination of mobileshare supplementary plan
FAQ Question: Is there any penalty if I terminate my MobileShare Supplementary Plan?
Answers: There is a contractual period of 12 months. Pre-mature termination will apply accordingly based on the table below:MobileShare Supplementary Plan Penalty - $10.70 (List Price) x balance number of days unfulfilled.

Questions: I don't know where to find my IMSI number?
FAQ Question: What is my IMSI number for activating my SIM?
Answers: Your IMSI number is a set of 15 digits that can be found at the back of your SIM card.

Questions: When to start installation?
FAQ Question: When can I request for installation to take place?
Answers: You are required to book an appointment with NetLink Trust to lay the fibre and install the 1st TP to your home. Your NetLink Trust installation appointment may be scheduled at any of the following times: Mondays â€“ Fridays (excluding Weekends & Public Holidays) High-Rise 9am - 11am 11am - 1pm 2pm - 4pm 4pm - 6pm Landed 9am - 1 pm 2pm - 6pm Â Â  Thereafter you are required to attend to another appointment by SingNet to enable your Singtel Fibre BroadBand services Your SingNet Fibre installation appointment may be scheduled at any of the following times: Mondays â€“ Saturdays (excluding Sundays and Public Holidays) High-Rise 9am - 10.30am 10.30am - 12pm 12pm - 1.30pm 2pm - 3.30pm 3.30pm - 5pm 5pm - 6.30pm Landed 9am - 1pm 2pm - 6pm Â Â Â  The installation team will arrive within the indicated time slot

Questions: What is the minimum subscription for DataMore contract?
FAQ Question: What is the minimum subscription period? Can I cancel the service before my DataMore contract end date?
Answers: The minimum subscription period vary from 6 -12 months dependent on the DataMore you signed up for. Yes you may cancel your service before the contract ends. There is however a minimum subscription period of 6 months. Early termination charges apply.

Questions: I can't find my Singtel TV number?
FAQ Question: How do I retrieve my Singtel TV number?
Answers: There are two ways for you to retrieve your Singtel TV number: On your Singtel bill it would appear in this line â€˜Singtel TV NO. xxxxxxxxâ€ On My Singtel app under Singtel TV it would appear in this line â€˜No: xxxxxxxxâ€™ If the above options are not available to you you may call 1688 and speak to our call agents.

Questions: How to change my fibre device?
FAQ Question: I have damaged my Fibre equipment. How can I replace them?
Answers: You will be required to purchase the equipment (at prevailing rates) for replacement. Such equipment are: â€¢ Fibre Patch Cord â€¢ ONT (OpticalÂ Network Terminal)Â or ONR (Optical Network Router) For other equipment such as the Fibre Termination Point a NetLink Trust installation will be required and charges will be (at prevailing rates) dependant on scope of work.

Questions: If i upgrade to Singtel fibre, what happens to my balance
FAQ Question: What happens to the contract balance on my original contract of my mio Plan / mio Home after I have upgraded to a Singtel Fibre Broadband service plan?
Answers: Your original contract will be cease and you will start your new Singtel Fibre Broadband service plan on a 24-month contract if you meet the eligibility criteria.

Questions: Where is the 50% discount for DataMore?
FAQ Question: How do I enjoy the Singtel Circle 50% off DataMore?
Answers: Just join our Singtel Circle family on an eligible price plan to enjoy 50% off DataMore and purchase it via our friendly retail staff or call 1688. For more information on Singtel Circle please visit www.singtel.com/circle

Questions: Got waterproof?
FAQ Question: Is it waterproof?
Answers: No. The WatchPhone cannot be submerged in water or used in a shower. However it is rated to be splash proof which means it is safe to run it under the tap or use it for sports.

Questions: Supplementary plan for my child
FAQ Question: My child has an existing mobile line. Can I sign up MobileShare Supplementary Plan under his name?
Answers: No our Youth scheme policy only allows each child to one mobile line only.

Questions: How much to register for DataMore
FAQ Question: Is there a registration fee for signing up DataMore?
Answers: Yes there is a $10.70 registration fee for signing up DataMore. However this registration fee has been waived.

Questions: Off sharing of location
FAQ Question: How do I stop sharing my location?
Answers: You can use Privacy mode or stop location sharing with specific members of a circle.

Questions: I want to activate singtel IDD
FAQ Question: How can I activate my Singtel IDD services?
Answers: The steps to activate your Singtel IDD services depends on your service provider: If you are applying for your Singtel mobile or fixed line call 1688 If you are applying for your StarHub or M1 line call 104

Questions: I want to recontract my plan
FAQ Question: When can I recontract my plan?
Answers: You can check your recontract eligibility via My Account. For postpaid mobile plans you can also check your recontract eligibility via My Singtel app. An early device upgrade fee will apply if you are recontracting less than 21 months into your contract. For all services a downgrade penalty will apply if you changing to a lower tier plan before your contract ends.
